Entry.Name: Renegotiation attack
Entry.Description: Due to a flaw in the SSLv3 and TLS handshake process, an attacker is able to mount a Man-In-The-Middle. In this scenario, the attacker is able to inject plaintext within an existing data stream thus breaking its integrity and partially impersonating the sender.

Mitigation.Textual: Update the TLS library to a version that implements RFC 5746 (e.g. OpenSSL v0.9.8m+).
